description: This week, we are looking at the role of mass communication in society. Article to annotate: Habermas, J. (2022). Reflections and hypotheses on a further structural transformation of the political public sphere. Theory, Culture & Society, 39(4), 145-171.
This week, we are looking at Chomsky's Propaganda Model.

This week, we explore the role of cultural contexts and link them to our understanding of methods in research. Article to annotate: Clarke, R., & Charles, R. N. (2012). Caribbean liming: A metaphor for building social capital. International Journal of Cross Cultural Management, 12(3), 299-313.

This week, we explore the role of new media in shaping mass communication. Article to annotate: Maynard, D. M. B., & Jules, M. A. (2021). Exploring her roots: Black Caribbean hair identity and going natural using social media networks. Journal of Black Psychology, 47(1), 3-30.

This week, we look at the future of mass communication, including the advent of machine learning and AI. Article to annotate: Howard, A., & Borenstein, J. (2018). The ugly truth about ourselves and our robot creations: the problem of bias and social inequity. Science and engineering ethics, 24(5), 1521-1536.
